Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Chest Bioreactance and Calibrated Pulse Contour Analysis in Thoracic Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: prospective monocentre observational study included 50 adult patients

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a tertiary university hospital...Eligibility criteria included elective unilateral thoracic cancer surgery with PCA monitoring.

Intervention.evidence: Simultaneous cardiac index (CI) measurements using bioreactance (CI-NICOM) and PCA calibrated by transthoracic echocardiography (CI-PCA)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the interchangeability of chest bioreactance and calibrated pulse contour analysis (PCA) for cardiac output measurement.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the interchangeability of CI-NICOM and CI-PCA, assessed by Bland–Altman analysis and percentage error calculation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 50 adult patients undergoing thoracic cancer surgery

Result_Outcome.evidence: CI-PCA and CI-NICOM differed significantly: 2.4 ± 0.8 vs. 2.9 ± 0.9 l min −1 m −2, respectively (P < 0.001).
